summary: Yerba mate is a plant from South America, used to make a caffeinated drink called 'mate' or 'terer√©'. The leaves are steeped in hot or cold water. Native to Paraguay, it was first enjoyed by the Guarani people. After the Jesuits saw its popularity, it spread across South America. Today, mate is popular in many countries, including Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil. It has also gained worldwide attention, appearing in energy drinks and as a bottled tea.
title: Yerba mate
